question.title: Apache Spark pre requisite
question.body:
The problem I am facing is with installing the corresponding dependencies for spark in Ubuntu. For example, apache spark 3.3.x needs another version of Python, an older version of Java etc. — Same for graphframes. So I am not sure which version of dependency to download for my assignment. Where do I check what version of spark needs which version of dependencies?

I tried ChatGPT and Gemini. ChatGPT said to install openjdk 11, while Gemini said to install openjdk 17 and python 3.1.x — but the problem still persists.

answers.body:
You don’t need to guess Spark dependencies — Apache Spark documents the required Java and Python versions for every release. For Spark 3.3.x, the official Spark documentation states:

Java requirement

Spark 3.3.x requires Java 8 or Java 11. It does not support Java 17.

Python requirement

Spark 3.3.x supports Python 3.7 – 3.10. Python 3.11+ is not supported.

So the correct setup for Spark 3.3.x on Ubuntu is:

Code

Java: OpenJDK 8 or OpenJDK 11
Python: 3.7, 3.8, 3.9, or 3.10

Where to check dependencies

You can always find the exact compatibility matrix in the official Spark documentation under:

Spark → Documentation → Release Notes → “Supported Java Versions” and “Supported Python Versions”

This is the authoritative source — not AI models, blogs, or random tutorials.

GraphFrames compatibility

GraphFrames versions are tied to Spark major/minor versions, not Java/Python. For Spark 3.3.x, you must install:

Code

graphframes:0.8.2-spark3.3-s_2.12

If you install a GraphFrames version built for a different Spark version, it will fail to load.

To run Spark 3.3.x correctly:

  • Install OpenJDK 11 (or 8)

  • Install Python 3.7–3.10

  • Use the GraphFrames version built for Spark 3.3

This will resolve the dependency issues you’re seeing.

question_comments.body: The spark website clearly says what versions of Java is required. Python is optional
